alert.note: Alert for Clay; Estill; Jackson; Laurel; Lee; Owsley; Pulaski; Rockcastle; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 2:44AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Laurel, northwestern Owsley, southern Estill, northeastern Pulaski, Jackson, eastern Rockcastle, Lee, west central Wolfe and northwestern Clay Counties through 315 AM EDT... At 243 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Climax to Pongo. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts between 25 to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Kerby Knob, Clover Bottom, Shirley, Sandgap, Collingsworth, Eglon, Morrill, Threelinks, Goochland and Loam around 250 AM EDT. Brazil, Alcorn, Hisel, Locust Branch, Foxtown, Waneta, Jep Hill and Pittsburg around 255 AM EDT. Eberle, Victory, Mershons, Blanton Flats, Templer, Lamero, Cruise, Carico, Wind Cave and Atlanta around 300 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Cornelius, Peoples, Moores Creek, Leighton, Alumbaugh, Parrot, Deese, Drip Rock, Greenmount, Old Orchard, McKee, Willow Shoals, Annville, Settle Store, Welchburg, Green Hill, Pinnacle, Bond, Evelyn, Yellow Rock, Beattyville, Zekes Point, Mount Olive, Tyner, Herd, Egypt, Maulden, Whynot, Old Landing and Shepherdtown. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 42 and 60. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 3 and 5. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 34 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Estill; Jackson; Laurel; Lee; Owsley; Pulaski; Rockcastle; Wolfe
